java_questions.questionText: Java is an object-oriented programming language.
java_questions.explanation: Java is a general-purpose, class-based, object-oriented programming language.

java_questions.questionText: Which statement would you use to print the string "Hello" in Java?
java_questions.explanation: To print a statement in Java, you use the System.out.println() method (though you can also use the System.out.print() method). The other methods are for printing statements in other programming languages.

java_questions.questionText: What Java statement do you need to find the square root of 10.89?
java_questions.explanation: To find the square root of any double in Java, you can use the Math.sqrt() method.

java_questions.questionText: There are three types of loops you can use in Java. One is the do-while loop. What are the names of the other two kinds of loops?
java_questions.explanation: The other two kinds of loops are the for loop and the while loop.

In the first image, the loop iterates three times (i = 0, i = 1, i = 2). Once i = 3, the loop stops. In the second image, the loop continues until i > 3, so it executes four times (i = 0, i = 1, i = 2, i = 3).
